# NSWritingToolsCoordinator.TextUpdateReason

**Enumeration**

Constants that specify the reason you updated your view’s content outside of the Writing Tools workflow.

## Declaration

```swift
enum TextUpdateReason
```

## Overview

If you modify your view’s text storage while Writing Tools is active, report those changes to your [doc://com.apple.appkit/documentation/AppKit/NSWritingToolsCoordinator] object so it can track them correctly. Call the [doc://com.apple.appkit/documentation/AppKit/NSWritingToolsCoordinator/updateRange(_:with:reason:forContextWithIdentifier:)] method to report changes that occur inside one of your context objects. Call the [doc://com.apple.appkit/documentation/AppKit/NSWritingToolsCoordinator/updateForReflowedTextInContextWithIdentifier(_:)] method for changes that affect the layout of your text, such as text insertions before a context object or changes to your view’s frame rectangle.

## Getting the reasons

- **NSWritingToolsCoordinator.TextUpdateReason.typing**: An operation that involved a person editing the text in your view.
- **NSWritingToolsCoordinator.TextUpdateReason.undoRedo**: An operation that changed the view’s text as part of an undo or redo command.

## Initializers

- **init(rawValue:)**

## Reporting changes to Writing Tools

- **updateRange(_:with:reason:forContextWithIdentifier:)**: Informs the coordinator about changes your app made to the text in the specified context object.
- **updateForReflowedTextInContextWithIdentifier(_:)**: Informs the coordinator that a change occurred to the view or its text that requires a layout update.

## Conforms To

- RawRepresentable
- Sendable
- SendableMetatype
